body:
Trying to build `adios` with `+netcdf+hdf5` support but I keep getting conflicting specs due to the +mpi part of the specs for both. 

### Expected Result
Concretized spec of adios with adios built with netcdf+mpi and hdf5 +mpi

### Actual Result
```console
spack install adios+hdf5+netcdf
==> Error: Conflicts in concretized spec "adios@1.13.0%cce@8.6.2+blosc~bzip2~fortran+hdf5~infiniband+lz4+mpi+netcdf patches=8ae17f655248e87cbab1d1ed794e15364a38d2f5f8d971b1086702f72d79bd42 ~shared staging= +sz~szip+zfp+zlib arch=cray-cnl6-haswell /b2brmth"

  List of matching conflicts for spec:

    netcdf@4.4.1.1.3%cce@8.6.2~dap~hdf4 maxdims=1024 maxvars=8192 +mpi+parallel-netcdf+shared arch=cray-cnl6-haswell

1. "+mpi" conflicts with "netcdf^hdf5~mpi" [netcdf+mpi requires hdf5+mpi]
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue
Log into Cori
```console
spack install adios+hdf5+netcdf
```

### Information on your system

Cori (Cray-XC40)
custom packages.yaml
```yaml
packages:
    all:
        compiler: [intel@18.0.1.163, gcc@7.1.0, cce@8.6.2]
        variants: ~shared
        providers:
            mpi: [mpich]
            mkl: [intel-mkl]
            blas: [intel-mkl, cray-libsci]
            scalapack: [intel-mkl, cray-libsci]
            pkgconfig: [pkg-config]
    cmake:
        buildable: false
        paths:
            cmake@3.5.2: /usr
    pkg-config:
        buildable: false
        paths:
            pkg-config@0.28: /usr
    mpich:
        buildable: false
        modules:
            mpich@7.6.2%gcc+pmi+romio: cray-mpich
            mpich@7.6.2%intel+mpi+romio: cray-mpich
            mpich@7.6.2%cce+mpi+romio: cray-mpich
    intel-mkl:
        buildable: false
        paths:
            intel-mkl@2018.1.163%gcc+ilp64 threads=openmp: /opt/intel
            intel-mkl@2018.1.163%intel+ilp64 threads=openmp: /opt/intel
            intel-mkl@2018.1.163%cce+ilp64 threads=openmp: /opt/intel
    fftw:
        buildable: false
        modules:
            fftw@3.3.6.2%gcc+openmp: cray-fftw
            fftw@3.3.6.2%intel+openmp: cray-fftw
            fftw@3.3.6.2%cce+openmp: cray-fftw
    hdf5:
        buildable: false
        variants: +mpi
        modules:
            hdf5@1.10.0.3%gcc+cxx+fortran+hl+szip+mpi: cray-netcdf-hdf5parallel
            hdf5@1.10.0.3%intel+cxx+fortran+hl+szip+mpi: cray-netcdf-hdf5parallel
            hdf5@1.10.0.3%cce+cxx+fortran+hl+szip+mpi: cray-netcdf-hdf5parallel
    cray-libsci:
        buildable: false
        modules:
            cray-libsci@17.09.1%intel: cray-libsci
            cray-libsci@17.09.1%gcc: cray-libsci
            cray-libsci@17.09.1%cce: cray-libsci
    netcdf:
        buildable: false
        variants: +mpi
        modules:
            netcdf@4.4.1.1.3%intel+mpi+parallel-netcdf^hdf5+mpi: cray-netcdf-hdf5parallel
            netcdf@4.4.1.1.3%gcc+mpi+parallel-netcdf^hdf5+mpi: cray-netcdf-hdf5parallel
            netcdf@4.4.1.1.3%cce+mpi+parallel-netcdf^hdf5+mpi: cray-netcdf-hdf5parallel
    petsc:
        buildable: false
        modules:
            petsc@3.7.2%intel+boost~complex+mumps~int64: cray-petsc
            petsc@3.7.2%gcc+boost~complex+mumps~int64: cray-petsc
            petsc@3.7.2%cce+boost~complex+mumps~int64: cray-petsc
            petsc@3.7.2%intel+boost~complex+mumps+int64: cray-petsc-64
            petsc@3.7.2%gcc+boost~complex+mumps+int64: cray-petsc-64
```

title: netcdf and hdf5 always have conflicting specs
